title: sonic_team
body:
The in-house [[Sega]]-owned development team for video games of the [[Sonic (series)|]] series since the [[Sega Mega Drive|Genesis/Mega Drive]] era. They were originally known as [b]Sega AM8[/b] prior to the 90's and are responsible for the development processes for the [[sonic adventure|Sonic]] [[sonic adventure 2|Adventure]] games, [[Sonic Heroes]], [[shadow the hedgehog (game)|Shadow The Hedgehog]], [[Sonic Riders]], [[sonic the hedgehog (2006)|Sonic 2006]], [[Sonic Unleashed]], etc. Also worked on the handheld games on the [[Game Boy Advance]] and [[Nintendo DS]], namely the [[Sonic Advance]] and [[sonic rush|Rush]] games with the help of the developer, Dimps. The team has also developed other Sega games like [[nights into dreams|NiGHTS into dreams…]], the [[Phantasy Star]] series, [[Burning Rangers]], [[PuyoPuyo Fever]], [[Samba de Amigo]], [[Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg]], and [[Chu Chu Rocket]] respectively. Formerly lead by Naka Yuji, now under the leadership of Iizuka Takashi.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sonic Team":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Team
* "Wikipedia (Japanese): Sonic Team":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%BD%E3%83%8B%E3%83%83%E3%82%AF%E3%83%81%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0
* "Wikipedia: List of Sonic Team games":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Sonic_Team_games
* "Official website (inactive)":https://www.sonicteam.com/

title: sonic_unleashed
body:
[b]Sonic Unleashed[/b] (known as [b]Sonic World Adventure[/b] in Japan) is a 2008 action-adventure platformer game developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]] for the Wii, PlayStation 2, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3.

The game follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] as he attempts to restore the world to normal after his nemesis, [[Dr. Eggman]], splits the world's continents into pieces with a powerful new ray weapon and the power of the Chaos Emeralds to harness the power of [[Dark Gaia]], as well as his struggles with his new beast form generated by Dark Gaia's energies, [[Sonic the Werehog]]. With [[Chip (Sonic)|]]'s help, Sonic must travel around the globe to both return to his normal form and stop Dr. Eggman from breaking up the world.

h4. External links
* "Sonic Retro: Sonic Unleashed":http://info.sonicretro.org/Sonic_Unleashed
* "Wikipedia: Sonic Unleashed":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Unleashed
other_names: ソニックワールドアドベンチャー

title: spotty_bulbear
body: Scientific Name: Oculus terribilis dotticum A subspecies of [[Bulborb]] that appears throughout the [[Pikmin_(series)|]] series. They are recognized compared to other varieties by their black backs with red spots, as well as having larger lips. Bulbears are notably one of the few species of Bulborb that can be found awake during the day, patrolling a large territory in search of potential prey, usually with up to three [[dwarf bulbear|dwarf bulbears]] in tow. h4. External links * "Pikmin Wiki: Spotty Bulbear":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Spotty_Bulbear]

title: bulborb
body: Scientific Name: Oculus kageyamii russus A common enemy in the [[Pikmin (series)|]] series, as well as arguably its most iconic. It is a bipedal creature of varying sizes with a beige face and has a red back with white spots, though their color may vary between different sub species. h4. External links * "Pikmin Wiki: Bulborb":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Bulborb]

title: what_is_a_man?
body:
[quote]
Richter Belmont: Die, monster! You don't belong in this world!
Dracula: It was not by my hand that I'm once again given flesh. I was called here by humans who wish to pay me tribute.
Richter: "Tribute"?! You steal men's souls, and make them your slaves!
Dracula: Perhaps the same could be said of all religions.
Richter: Your words are as empty as your soul! Mankind ill needs a savior such as you!
Dracula: What is a man? [flings his wine glass aside] A miserable little pile of secrets! But enough talk! Have at you!
[/quote]

A [[meme]] originating from a dialogue between [[Richter Belmont]] and [[Dracula (castlevania)|]] in the prologue of [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]]. The dialogue has been widely parodied for its over-the-top delivery.

This quote is not present in the Japanese version, and in fact, it originates from a quote from the French author André Malraux's book "Antimémoires".

Use this tag for parodies of the scene or dialogue.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Die Monster / What Is A Man?":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/die-monster-what-is-a-man

title: yosakoi
body:
A style of Japanese [[dancing]]. Dancers typically wear [[Japanese clothes]] such as [[happi]] or [[yukata]]. A unique aspect is the use of [[naruko (instrument)|]]s, handheld wooden clappers.

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yosakoi]

title: naruko_(instrument)
body:
The word originally means wooden clappers, being used to scare birds away from rice fields.
"Yosakoi dancers":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yosakoi#Costumes_and_naruko use a type of percussion instrument, named after / derived from the clappers.

h4.See also

title: potbelly_stove
body:
A potbelly stove is a cylindrical device that bulges in the middle with a flat stove surface on the top.  They used wood or coal as fuel and were used for both heating and cooking.

The  name is derived from the bulge in the middle, which was reminiscent of a fat person's pot belly.

h4. See also

* [[Heater]]
* "Wikipedia - Potbelly stove":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potbelly_stove]

title: gears
body:
A mechanical part of a clockwork system, a gear is a wheel with so-called flanks so it will interlock with other gears and spin. Radius of the wheel and edge sizes allow spinning at different speeds and thus make processing different. Obviously used the most in non-digital [[watch|watches]]. An important part of [[steampunk]] culture.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Technology]]

title: rhodesia
body:
[b]Rhodesia[/b] was a [[United Kingdom|British]] colony and later an unrecognised country in Africa, which is now [[Zimbabwe]] and parts of [[Zambia]]. Ruled by the white minority with similar apatheid-like segregation laws with [[South Africa]], the country collapsed in 1980 after the Rhodesian Bush war and replaced by Zimbabwe.

The Rhodesian military is known for their usage of [[short shorts]], and for creating the [[Rhodesian Brushstroke]] camouflage pattern.

title: imperial_war_flag
body:
The Imperial War Flag (German: Reichskriegsflagge) was the war flag and war ensign of the Imperial German armed forces of the [[German Empire]]. It consists of a black nordic cross with the Prussian eagle in the center, over a white background, with the [[Imperial German flag]] defaced with an [[iron cross]] in the canton.

It was frequently used by neo-[[Nazi]] groups as a substitute for the banned [[Nazi flag]].

h4. See Also
* [[Imperial German Flag]]
* [[Nazi War Ensign]]

title: speed_limit_sign
body:
[[Road sign]] that shows the permitted maximum speed (in kilometer or mile) of a vehicle. It comes in various formats. In many countries such as the EU, Russia and Japan, they are simply encircled numbers. While in the US, the sign takes a rectangular shape and often contain all caps inscription that accompany the number.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: double_penetration
body:
A sexual position in which two of a character's orifices (mouth, [[pussy|vagina]], and [[anus]]) are being penetrated by [[penis]], [[tentacles]], [[clenched hand]], [[dildo]], other inanimate objects  or a combination thereof, OR when one orifice is being penetrated by two of these objects at the same time ([[double vaginal]] or [[double anal]]). May occur together with the [[spitroast|spitroast position]] and [[group sex]]. Also known as a "sandwich" and also abbreviated as "DP".

This can be seen at the same time as [[imminent double penetration]] if both the imminent penetration and actual penetration are depicted in the same image, typically a comic. (post #2363609)

title: balmung_(fire_emblem)
body:

Used by the Crusader and founder of the kingdom of Isaach, Od and is passed down through his bloodline until it is inherited by his decendent [[Shannan (Fire Emblem)|Shannan]].

title: shannan_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character from the second generation of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]. The crown prince of Isaach, he is the inheritor to the holy blade [[Balmung (Fire Emblem)|]] and the heir to Isaach. He is the elder cousin of [[Larcei (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Scathach (fire emblem)|]].

Together with [[Oifey (Fire Emblem)|]], Shannan raised [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]], his cousins and their fellow descendants of the first-generation party in the northern Isaachian village of Tirnanog. As such, Shannan and Seliph share a brotherly bond.

Holy Blood: [b]Od[/b] (major)

title: turnaround
body:
A character, often [[full body]], viewed form the same angle with different degrees of rotation while keeping the same pose and outfit. A technique commonly used on [[reference sheet]]s to demonstrate a character's entire design. This varies from a simple [[straight-on|front]] (0º) and [[from behind|back]] (180º) view to supplemental in-between angles such as the [[from side|side]] (90º) and 45º views.

For characters literally turning around for uses other than display, use [[turning around]] instead.

title: tiktok_dodging_trend_(meme)
body:
TikTok Dodging Trend is a trend set to "Forget" Slowed Down, a slowed-down remix of Pogo's song "Forget." The remix inspired the viral trend on TikTok in September 2022 where one user mock stabs and swings at another with a stick, bat or another object as they rhythmically dodge the stabs.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/tiktok-dodging-trend-forget-slowed-down-pogo

title: toca_toca_toca_dance_(meme)
body:
Toca Toca Toca Dance, also known as Toca Toca Dance or Toca Toca Anime Dance, refers to a dance trend in which both real people and animated characters mimic the movements of anime dances to the song "Toca Toca" by Fly Project. The trend became prevalent on TikTok and YouTube as multiple Toca Toca memes and animations surfaced in early 2023.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/toca-toca-toca-dance

title: rutee_katrea
body:
The main heroine of [[Tales of Destiny]]. Rutee works as a Lens Hunter along with her partner [[Mary Argent]], and wields the Swordian of Water, Atwight. Many are annoyed by her greedy ways, but she doesn't let it bother her. She eventually marries [[Stahn Aileron]] and becomes the mother of [[Kyle Dunamis]]. Her seiyuu is [[imai yuka (voice actor)|Imai Yuka]].

[spoiler]Rutee discovers that she has a long-lost brother - he is Leon Magnus.[/spoiler]

title: asbestos_(arknights)
body:
[i]Asbestos, contracted explorer to Rhodes Island, is very reluctant to serve under you.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rim Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Savra[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]156 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

One of Rim Billiton’s more famous explorers. Asbestos was recommended to Rhodes Island for treatment by Operator [[Magallan (Arknights)|]], and signed an agreement to become an operator after negotiation.

She has [[colored_inner_hair|colored inner hair]], wears a [[baseball cap]] and [[headphones]] on her head. She has a [[green_eyes|green eye]], while the other eye, typically covered by an [[eyepatch]] is [[purple_eyes|purple]]. In game, she's shown to wear a [[yellow jacket]] and a [[black bodysuit]]. The famous explorer carries around a personally modified [[shield]], [[lantern]] and a [[backpack]]. 

Due to her race, she has salamander aspects, like her [[lizard tail]] and [[sharp teeth]]. Her callsign is taken from a heat-resistant, fibrous silicate mineral.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Shindou Kei (voice Actor)|]].

h4. Skins

title: garrod_ran
body:
Protagonist of [[After War Gundam X]]. Garrod is an "everyman" (read as: mercenary), casually doing tasks he's assigned with to survive. However, his life is permanently altered once he takes up the mission to locate a particular girl named [[Tiffa Adill]] and stumbles into the cockpit of the all-powerful [[Gundam X]]. He later on pilots the [[Gundam X Divider]] (remodeled version of his Gundam X unit after it got heavily damaged) and the [[Gundam Double X]] (Gundam X' direct successor).

Voiced by: [[Takagi Wataru (voice Actor)|]]

title: airfield_princess
body:
Airfield Princess is an enemy [[abyssal ship]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. She was the boss of the fourth event map during the Fall 2013 event.

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white_hair|white]] hair, [[orange eyes]], and small [[horns]]. She wears a white [[leotard]] and has two rows of two spikes each along her lower back. She also wears white [[ankle boots]] with two spikes underneath them. Her right arm seems to be either a [[single mechanical arm]] or wearing a [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] with claws.

She is nicknamed "Henderson-chan" or just "Henderson" as a reference to "Henderson Field":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henderson_Field_%28Guadalcanal%29, which is what she is based on.

h5.Voiced by:
* [[Misato (voice actor)|]] (2013-2015)
* [[Ishigami Shizuka]] (2015- )
* [[Sakakibara Yoshiko]] (2015, [[Kantai Collection (Anime)|anime-only]])

title: mizumoto_yukari

水本 ゆかり

An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. Yukari is a prodigy flute soloist from the Amori region of Japan. She is refined and calm, although she's a little concerned about becoming an idol. She has played the flute in a classical style since childhood, and doesn’t use her flutist trait as an overt stage gimmick. Besides her hobby in flutes, she also has some interest in theater.

title: super_fumina
body:
[[Gundam Build Fighters Try]] character. A [[Mecha Musume]] and/or Armor Girls Project-esque fusion of [[Hoshino Fumina]] and her [[Powered GM Cardigan]], built (without her consent) by [[Sakai Minato]] of the Gunpla Shingyo School.

A Titans-themed maid recolor of this gunpla was released via the Premium Bandai online shop to commemorate the release of Gundam Build Fighters Try: Island Wars; an AEUG-themed maid recolor was a Gunpla EXPO World Japan limited release. Another variant -- inspired by the [[Qubeley]] -- was subsequently released as the Super Fumina Axis Angel. A [[Sazaki Kaoruko]] variant called the [[Hyper Gyanko]] and a combination with the [[Winning Gundam]] called the Winning Fumina were also released with the Build Fighters Battlogue series.

Its real life designer is [[Shimada Fumikane]], famous for designing various mecha musume.

h4. External links

* "Gundam Wiki: Super Fumina":[https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/SF-01_Super_Fumina]

title: mexico_ufo_alien_bodies_hearing_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] referring to the Mexican Congress holding a hearing on September 12th, 2023, during which supposed "non-human" [[alien]] corpses were displayed to Mexican politicians.

The event was reportedly led by Mexican journalist and UFO enthusiast Jaime Maussan, who testified under oath to say that the two alien corpses retrieved were not part of "our terrestrial evolution." Following the congressional hearing, news of the purported aliens presented by Maussan became prominent topics of discourse and memes online. The event notably came a month after David Grusch testified to the U.S. Congress about UAPs.

There is also a trend of combining this meme with the [[guy tired after sex (meme)|]] meme.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Mexico UFO Alien Bodies Hearing":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/mexico-ufo-alien-bodies-hearing

title: team_kirby_clash_deluxe
body:
A free-to-play, 4-player co-op [[Kirby_(series)|]] game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]].

This is an expanded version of the [i]Team Kirby Clash[/i] minigame from [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]]. Unlike other [i]Kirby[/i] games, this game is free to start. The main currency is Gem Apples, which [[Magolor]] utlizes to run his Shoppe. Gem Apples are needed to progress through the game, and you can get them from completing tasks in-game or purchasing them from the [[Nintendo eShop]].

Like the original version, the gameplay is essentially nothing but boss fights, some of which only appear in this game.

title: magal_(miss_magal)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Magal (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the post-anniversary 2021 'Basic Deduction' skin collection.

Magal does away with her usual tactical attire for a more 'traditional [[detective]]' look, putting on a [[white shirt]] with a [[corset]], paired with [[black pants|black]] [[asymmetrical pants]] (her right leg ending at short length and having a [[thigh strap]]), completed with a [[hat]] and [[brown coat|brown]] [[coat]] whose sleeves go past [[sleeves past fingers|her fingers]]. Her usual long hair has been tied up for a [[double bun]] look. She's seen holding a [[notebook]] and [[quill]], reading to jot down clues on the crime scene.

title: exterminator_(blame!)
body:
Exterminators are a subset of [[Safeguard (blame!)|]] that often appear as black and white [[humanoid robot]]s. They use primitive weaponry, often their [[claws]] or melee weapons, though stronger versions are capable of [[energy]] attacks.
They often attack in large numbers, similar to a horde of zombies. But also a handful can pose a serious threat to anyone without the Net Terminal Gene. This is because they possess a strong armor which can't be penetrated by normal weapons.
Most of the time the Exterminators bear the Safeguard -|- symbol on their [[forehead]].

title: real_world_location
body:
An image set in a known location in the real world.

The location could be a well-known building or landmark, or it could be an ordinary street or building with a known location.

The location should be depicted fairly accurately, so a fictionalized location with a well-known building or landmark in the background does not count. [[photo (medium)|Photos]] and [[photo background]]s also do not qualify.

Where known, please leave a comment providing some kind of location information (a Google maps link, latitude/longitude, etc). Famous buildings and landmarks should be given a tag.

h4. See also

* [[in-universe location]]
* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

title: yoroi_mikoto
body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. There are two versions of Mikoto, the female one in Unlimited and [[Muv-luv alternative|Alternative]]  and the male one in Extra. While the male and female versions of the character are almost physically identical, the kanji used for their first names are different ([b]美琴[/b] for the female version and [b]尊人[/b] for the male version). Both versions of Mikoto have [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[antenna hair]].

Mikoto is voiced by [[Lynn (voice actor)|]] in the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]] and succeeding works.

title: plap_plap_plap_get_pregnant_(meme)
body:
A copypasta [[Twitter]] trend in which users post an image of a character from a given fandom and repeatedly write the word "[[PLAP]]," an onomatopoeia for sex noises, followed by repeatedly writing "GET PREGNANT," expressing a desire to [[impregnation|impregnate]] the character.

"GET PREGNANT" is a rather literal translation of 孕め, common dialogue in eromanga. 

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Plap Plap Get Pregnant":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/plap-plap-get-pregnant]

title: toyotarou
body:
[b]Toyotaro[/b] (initially working under the name [b]Toyble[/b]) is the official artist of the manga version of [[Dragon Ball Super]]. He is [[Toriyama Akira|Akira Toriyama]]'s chosen successor. He was initially a doujin artist (prominently doing his own version of the infamous [[Dragon Ball AF]] parallel to [[youngjijii|Young Jijii]]'s version) before being hired by Shueisha to work on [[Dragon Ball Heroes|Dragon Ball Heroes: Victory Mission]]. From there, he did the manga adaptation for [[dragon ball z fukkatsu no f|Resurrection 'F']] and was later chosen for Super.

h4. External links:

* Dragon Ball Wiki: "Toyotaro":http://dragonball.wikia.com/wiki/Toyotar%C5%8D

title: warugaki_(sk-ii)
body:
Artist. Quite possibly the grand master of mixing cute, epic, and absurd all at once, with only [[imizu_(nitro_unknown)|Imizu-san]] rivaling him. "Beware the non-threatening ones" would be a general rule of thumb in his works.

Is friends with many prominent artists and others from the doujin scene. Probably the most iconic are [[Vegas_(akg)|]] and [[Ryuuichi (f dragon)|]], who often accompany him in his report mangas.  

Noteable as a fan of [[Touhou]] and [[Grappler Baki]], and as such often mixed them together in his works.

body:

He has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]], and wears a [[black suit|black]] [[business suit]] and [[black necktie|tie]]. He has a [[medical eyepatch]] over his right eye, and an [[id card]] on the left breast of his suit.

title: f.l.u.d.d.
body:
The "Flash Liquidizer Ultra Dousing Device", better known as F.L.U.D.D. or FLUDD and pronounced "flood", is a multipurpose water pack from [[Super Mario Sunshine]]. It was invented by [[Professor Elvin Gadd]] and is carried like a backpack. Since F.L.U.D.D. is able to converse with [[Mario]], it's believed to be equipped with some kind of artificial intelligence.  In Japanese it is just called a "pump" (ポンプ).

h4. External links

* Mario Wiki: "F.L.U.D.D.":[http://www.mariowiki.com/F.L.U.D.D.]

title: bodeo_m1889
body:
The [b]Bodeo Model 1889[/b] (Pistola a Rotazione, Sistema Bodeo, Modello 1889) was an Italian six-shot [[revolver]] named after the head of the Italian [[gun|firearm]] commission, Carlo Bodeo. Produced between 1889 and 1931, it served the Italian military during the Two World Wars.

The [[weapon]] is characterized by its foldable trigger guard, collared ejector rod, and most models have hexagonal or octagonal barrel.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "IMFDb":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/Bodeo_M1889
* "Wikipedia: Bodeo Model 1889":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodeo_Model_1889

title: taking_shelter
body:
The act of going underneath something in order to protect oneself from bad weather, most often [[rain]] or [[snow]]. One could take shelter [[under bridge|under a bridge]], an [[awning]], a [[bus stop]], or a [[under tree|tree]], among other possible locations or objects.

Not to be confused with [[taking cover]], for when a character attempts to protect themselves from danger.

h4. See also

* [[improvised umbrella]]

title: k-50m
body:
The [b]K-50M[/b] was a North [[Vietnam]]ese modification of the [[PPSh-41]] [b][[submachine gun]][/b]. It was used by the "PAVN":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Army_of_Vietnam and [[Viet Cong|Việt Cộng]] during the [[Vietnam War]].
The [[gun]] features a retractable wire stock modelled after the [[MAT-49]] and an [[AK-47]] pistol grip. Chambered in 7.62×25mm [[cartridge]], the K-50M accepts both curved 35-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and the 71-round [[drum magazine|drum one]].

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PPS-43]]

h1. External links
* "ForgottenWeapons.com":https://www.forgottenweapons.com/north-vietnamese-k-50m-submachine-gun/
* "Gun Wiki":https://guns.fandom.com/wiki/K50M

title: odekake_kozame
body:
[b][i]Odekake Kozame[/b][/i] (おでかけ子ザメ, "Little Shark's Outings") is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Penguinbox]]. Originally published as a web manga on Twitter in June 2021, it was later picked up for serialization by Kadokawa Corporation and Enterbrain. An ONA anime adaptation by ENGI began releasing on YouTube in August 2023.

It can be read at "Pixiv series #126364":[https://www.pixiv.net/user/61623963/series/126364] and pool #19306.

h4.Synopsis
The adventures of a baby shark in nostalgia-filled Yauo Town.

Whether it's cider on a summer day, freeze pops, radio calisthenics, festival stalls, or hanging out with friends, the world sparkles when reflected in the eyes of the baby shark.

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odekake_Kozame]
* "MyAnimeList":[https://myanimelist.net/anime/55463/Odekake_Kozame]
* "Official website":[https://odekake-kozame.com/]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/kozame_info]
* "Youtube":[https://www.youtube.com/@odekake-kozame]

title: desu
body:
A meme that started from [[4chan]] and comes from [[Suiseiseki]] of [[Rozen Maiden]], and her tendency of saying "desu" after everything. The starter of the meme is when /a/ spammed /b/ with it, and they adopted it as a meme. It is usually used as spam.

The tag should only be used if "desu" or "です" appears in the image (either by itself or if there is an emphasis on the word), or in rare cases where the character Suiseiseki is used as a replacement for the term (post #266173).

More recently associated with [[Kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]] of [[Kantai Collection]] as well, who also tends to use this word a lot.

title: super_saiyan_rose
body:
A form of [[Super Saiyan]] and a variation of [[Super Saiyan Blue]] which was initially exclusive to [[Goku Black]]. In this form, his hair and eyes turns [[pink hair|pink]] and [[grey eyes|grey]], respectively.

Its pink color has been theorized by [spoiler]Future [[Zamasu]] being due to a Saiyan possessing a proper divine status when he/she surpasses [[Super Saiyan God]] (with Super Saiyan Blue being the result if a Saiyan who surpasses Super Saiyan God is a mortal). Thus, in theory, if either [[Son Goku]] or [[Vegeta]] accepts the god positions offered to them, they will gain access to this form which probably, will replace their Super Saiyan Blue forms. [/spoiler] 

[[Fused Zamasu]] later on achieves this form, but the difference is that the [[white hair]] color of his Zamasu side is retained instead of turning pink. Probably because Zamasu is not a Saiyan himself so his fused version doesn't have the hair color changes of various Super Saiyan forms.

title: kamehameha_(dragon_ball)
body:
The signature attack of the [[Dragon Ball]] series, a powerful energy blast technique that was first created by [[Muten Roushi]] and then learned by [[Son Goku]] after witnessing its use once, increasing in power with him throughout the series, and later being taught to his two sons, [[Son Gohan]] and [[Son Goten]]. Parodies of the attack, and the hands-together pose assumed to use it, are quite frequent.

The move's name is translated as "turtle energy wave", and is inspired by the name of the [[Hawaii]]an monarch [[King Kamehameha|of the same name]].

Not to be confused with the [[Hadouken]]. The Kamehameha is a beam rather than a ball.

h4. Variations
* [[Big Bang Kamehameha]]
* [[Father-Son Kamehameha]]
* [[Family Kamehameha]]
* [[Final Kamehameha]]

title: legendary_super_saiyan
body:
An extremely powerful and rare form of [[Super Saiyan]], first appearing in [[Dragon Ball Z]] Movie 8. This form was originally exclusive to [[Broly (dragon ball z)|]], as he appeared in Movies 8 and 10. Appearance-wise, the user's physique becomes extremely bulky, their eyes become blanked out, and their hair becomes [[green hair|green-colored]].

The form is reintroduced in [[Dragon Ball Super]] under Toriyama's supervision, being used by [[Kale (dragon ball)|]] and the newest incarnation of [[Broly (dragon ball super)|]] from [[Dragon Ball Super Broly]]. In this continuity, the form is either referred to as "[Super Saiyan] 'Berserk'" or "Uncontrollable Saiyan" (when referring to Kale) or as "Super Saiyan Full Power" (when referring to Broly; appropriating an older term used for Super Saiyan Stage 4).

If this form is assimilated, the user can become a [[Super Saiyan Blue|Super Saiyan God Super Saiyan]], which bears a physique and hair style similar to the [[Super Saiyan 1|first Super Saiyan form]], but with the usual yellow color replaced with blue.

title: pearl_fey
body:
Cousin of [[Mia Fey]] and [[Maya Fey|]]. Spirit medium in training. Daughter of [[Morgan Fey]]. [spoiler]Second in after Maya for the title of Master of the Kurain Channeling Technique, for which reason her mother devises several schemes to kill Maya and place Pearl as Master.[/spoiler]

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Harumi Ayasato

Pearl has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] usually styled into [[hair rings]] and [[grey eyes]]. Pearl's spirit medium costume includes a [[magatama necklace]] and a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]] worn over a [[short kimono|short]] [[white kimono]] tied with a [[pink sash]] [[waist bow]] [[obi]]. She wears [[geta]] on her legs.

title: mia_fey
body:
Mentor of [[Phoenix Wright]] in [i][[Ace Attorney]][/i]. Older sister of [[Maya Fey]] and cousin of [[Pearl Fey]]. Daughter of famous spirit medium [[Misty Fey]]. Nemesis of [[Dahlia Hawthorne]] for acquitting Phoenix of the murder of Doug Swallow. 

[spoiler]Murdered after first episode of the first game by [[Redd White]] for investigating his blackmailing operations. However, Maya (post #2401722) and Pearl (post #1299072) can channel her spirit to let her help Phoenix on tougher cases. Due to differences in clothing size, they both end up showing a lot of [[cleavage]] whenever this happens. Art of of this should be tagged with both Mia and whoever is channeling her.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]], and wears a [[skirt suit]] with a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], as well as a [[yellow scarf]] and blue [[magatama]] [[necklace]]. She also has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Chihiro Ayasato

title: maya_fey
body:
A main character of [i][[Ace Attorney]][/i]. Spirit medium who bodily transforms into whoever she is channeling. Younger sister of [[Mia Fey]] and daughter of the famous spirit medium [[Misty Fey]]. Works as assistant manager and co-counsel for defense attorney [[Phoenix Wright]].

[spoiler]Channels the spirit of Mia to help out with difficult cases (post #2401722). Due to differences in clothing size, she ends up showing a lot of [[cleavage]] whenever this happens. In any image depicting this, tag both characters.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[half updo]], with [[blunt bangs]] [[parted bangs|parted]] at the center, and wears large purple beads as [[hair ornament]]s on her long [[sidelocks]]. She wears the traditional [[Japanese clothes]] of a spirit medium, which in her case include a [[short kimono|short]], off-[[white kimono]] with a [[pink sash|pink]] [[obi]]; a [[purple jacket|purple]] [[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]]; and a yellow [[magatama]] [[necklace]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Mayoi Ayasato

title: splatterhouse
body:
A horror beat-'em-up series by [[Namco]] consisting of five [[video game]]s for various systems, mostly [[Sega Mega Drive]], [[PC Engine]], and PC, not to mention coin-op Arcade.

[i]Splatterhouse 1[/i] was released in 1988.
[i]Splatterhouse 2[/i] was released in 1992.
[i]Splatterhouse 3[/i] was released in 1993.

[[Splatterhouse: Wanpaku Graffiti]] was released in a Japan-only version in 1989. This game features the characters as mostly SD chibis and is not graphic like the other games are.

[i]Splatterhouse Remake[/i] (not official title), was released on November 23rd of 2010 for Western markets and is a 3D third person remake of the first game.

In the games, the player controls [[rick_(splatterhouse)|Rick Taylor]], a man who has, through his fusion with an Evil Mask, become extremely strong and who resembles to a great degree [[Jason Voorhees]], of the [[Friday the 13th]] movies.

The games take place in a variety of locations, but all have a common setting, in and around a frightening mansion filled with disgusting demons and monsters.

The point of the games, with the exception of part 3, is to save Rick's girlfriend, [[Jennifer (Splatterhouse)|]], who has been targeted for one reason or another by the various demons and evil forces that inhabit the game's localities. 

In part 3 the player must use the map to find and save both Jennifer and their child from the demons, so it differs from the other games, which are mostly 2d side scrolling. Part 3 differs also because time limits are in place for the family saving mission portions of the game. Part 3 also differs in that Rick can 'power up' himself for a brief time to use vastly increased physical power to do drastic damage, as well as using some special moves. Finally, part 3 differs because enemies can be grabbed and slammed, headbutted, etc.

Rick can punch, kick, jump, equip various melee weapons, and perform a sliding kick. In most instances, his strength is evidenced by the brutal mutilation of the enemies due to the hitting power of his attacks. For example, zombie like enemies burst in half when struck. In part 2 and 3, it is revealed that the mask which granted him this power has an infernal, evil personality.

Weapons include: 2x4, Lead Pipe, Explosive Potion, Cleaver, Shotgun, Rock, and others.

It is suggested by the storyline of the first two games that the monsters have come about due to an unholy mix of science and magic and that the mask is a conduit of some ancient, hellish force that is not specifically named but that has much to do, albeit in the background, with the monsters and demons being there in the first place.

Play-through videos are avaliable at www.youtube.com.

Sources: Wikipedia pages.

title: paripi_koumei
body:
An ongoing 2019-to-present manga series written by [b]Yotsuba Yuuto[/b] with art by [[Ogawa Ryou]]. The story follows  [[Zhuge Kongming (paripi koumei)|]], who is reborn into present-day Tokyo, Japan. After hearing [[Tsukimi Eiko]] sing, he decides to help her become a successful musician as her "tactician". There is a Spring 2022 anime adaptation by [[P.A. Works]], as well as a live action TV series from October 2023.

title: freespace_2
body:
A 1999 [[3D]] [[Starfighter]] combat simulation [[video game]] for personal [[computer]]s.

[b]FreeSpace 2[/b] is a game developed by "Volition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volition_(company) as the sequel to "Descent: FreeSpace – The Great War":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Descent:_FreeSpace_%E2%80%93_The_Great_War . It was completed ahead of schedule in less than a year, and released to very positive reviews, but the game became a commercial failure, and was described by certain critics as one of 1999's most unfairly overlooked titles.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FreeSpace_2

title: schrodinger's_panties_(meme)
body:
A meme reference to the [[schrodinger's cat]] thought experiment sometimes used in the online Japanese community. Unlike [[no_panties]] or pool #2385, the meme specifically refers to when the author makes the question of whether or not a character is wearing panties the main idea of an image. Usually portrayed by text, speech, or visual storytelling. 

Should not be used for images in which whether or not a character is wearing panties is just ambiguous.

h4. See Also:
pool #2385

title: zarana
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toyline by [[Hasbro]], originally appearing in the [i]G.I. Joe[/i] comic series. 

[b]Zarana[/b] is a villainess, associated with G.I. Joe's nemesis [[terrorist]] organization, [[Cobra Command]]. She is a member of the [b]Dreadnoks[/b], a gang of destructive anarquists. 

A professional assassin, Zarana is an expert in disguise and the use of small arms, explosives and edged weapons. She is also the younger sister of [[Zartan]] and fraternal twin of [[Zandar]]. 

[[Lady Jaye]] is her nemesis.

title: hyouka
body:
Hyouka is the first book of the [[Kotenbu series]], a  novel series by Yonezawa Honobu that was first published in Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko in 2001. It's also the title used for the anime adaptation of [[Kotenbu Series]] by [[Kyoto Animation]] in 2012.manga illustrated by [[task owner]].

The story follows a severely unmotivated high school freshman named [[Oreki Houtarou]] who prefers to "conserve energy" as much as possible. When his older sister asks him to join the Classic Literature club to save it from disbandment, he reluctantly agrees. There he meets [[Chitanda Eru]], who joins at the same time as him. His longtime friend [[Fukube Satoshi]] and acquaintance [[Ibara Mayaka]] end up joining as well, and together, the group begins to investigate an incident at their school that occurred 44 years ago. Hints of the mystery are buried in an old collection of works previously belonging to the former members of the Classic Literature club. The collection is titled “Hyouka”.

h4. Characters

* [[Oreki Houtarou]]
* [[Chitanda Eru]]
* [[Fukube Satoshi]]
* [[Ibara Mayaka]]

* [[Toogaito Masashi]]

* [[Yuasa Shouko]]
* [[Kouchi Ayako]]

* [[Tani Koreyuki]]

* [[Oreki Tomoe]]

title: merkava_(tank)
body:
Hebrew מרכבה, "chariot"   
Japanese メルカバ

The Merkava is the main battle [[tank]] of the [[Israel]]i Defense Force. The Merkava's diesel engine is located in front, allowing space for a 60mm internal [[mortar_(weapon)|mortar]] and a rear clamshell door. Other armament includes a 120mm main gun (in a distinctive tapering turret), a .50 caliber machine gun, 2 7.62mm machine guns, and self-protection dispensers.

h4.See Also:

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* External Link - "Wikipedia: Merkava":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merkava & "LAHAT":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LAHAT

title: asmr
body:
The acronym for 'autonomous sensory meridian response'. Basically low-grade euphoria that is experienced as a tingling sensation that begins at the scalp and moves down the spine. A genre of videos intended to induce ASMR has emerged, over 15 million of which had been published on YouTube by 2021, most of which serve to help listeners fall asleep. ASMR videos often use a [[binaural microphone]] for the best results.

ASMR can occur in multiple formats in illustrations:

* The acronym being displayed in faux YouTube text (post #4603304)
* A performer using the specified equipment to produce such videos (post #4792035)

Some common actions during ASMR:
* [[blowing in ear]]
* [[ear cleaning]]
* [[licking ear]]
* [[whispering]]

h4. See Also
* [[eargasm]]

title: implied_anal
body:
If it's ambiguous whether a character is having sex or not, use [[implied sex]].
If a character is having sex and it's obvious that it's anal (such as with a male) but you can't see the penetration, use [[anal]] and [[sex]].
If a character is having sex but you can't tell whether it's anal or vaginal, use [[sex]].


Same logic applies to [[implied fingering]] vs [[fingering]].

title: shirayuki_ren
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Chigusa Minori]], featured in [[Shino to Ren]].

She has [[pink eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]], and [[medium breasts]]. Wears a [[black hairband|black]] [[hairband]] & [[black choker|black]] [[choker]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[jacket]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], [[striped necktie|striped]] [[necktie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|under skirt]].

Canonically in a relationship with [[Saotome Shino (shino To Ren)|]].

Her name was decided by "Twitter poll":https://twitter.com/minori_chigusa/status/1455098925061271554, with 44.8% of 10159 respondents voting for Jun-chan (純ちゃん), and 55.2% voting for Ren-chan (恋ちゃん).

title: kim_chowon
body:
Playable character from [[Counter:Side]].

Kim Chowon is a sniper of Alphatrix Innovation who can quickly reuse the functions installed in her weapon.

She is a veteran mercenary who learned to hunt C.O. before she learned arithmetic. She has spent more than half of her life inside the Counterside while helping the mining of unauthorized groups outside the social boundary.

She is currently attending school to help improve the corporate image, but she is having a difficult time fitting into normal teenage life. Above all, everyone is too polite to her ever since she barehandedly subdued a Counter criminal who broke into the school and went on the rampage.

title: shushing
body:
Shush, the index finger of one hand is extended and placed vertically in front of the lips, with the remaining fingers curled toward the palm with the thumb forming a fist; used to demand or request silence from those to whom it is directed. Can be silent or accompanied by an audible "Sssh!" sound which alone has the same meaning.

h4. See also

* [[finger to mouth]]

title: heinrich_(iron_saga)
body:
[[Iron Saga]] character. The enigmatic CEO of OATH Company. She leaves all regular operations of the company to her subordinate, [[midori (iron_saga)|Midori]]. She shows herself as the exemplar of a Mercenary Ace before her employees, but many of them see her as their "reliable senior." Very few employees know she is the company's CEO.

h4. External links

* "Iron Saga Wiki: Heinrich":https://ironsaga.fandom.com/wiki/Heinrich

title: thunderbolt_fantasy
body:
A Taiwanese-Japanese Wuxia puppet series, based on the [[Pili Budaixi|Pili puppet]] show series. Created and written by [[Urobuchi Gen]], it is produced as a collaboration between Nitroplus and Good Smile Company and Taiwanese puppet production company Pili International Multimedia. The series was aired in Japanese in Japan, Mandarin Chinese in China and Taiwanese Min-nan in Taiwan.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia: Thunderbolt Fantasy":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thunderbolt_Fantasy]

title: pillory
body:
A device that restrains a person's torso and/or neck, and often the limbs as well. Often in the shape of two boards that lock together, with indentations for the victim's parts; for a representative example see post #4279357. Other designs exist as well, such as the curved design worn by [[briar_(league_of_legends)|Briar]].

For boards that only restrain the limbs, use the tag [[stocks]].

title: shaula_(re:zero)
body:
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]. Shaula is a humanoid Demon Beast of the Augria Sand Dunes, formally debuting in Arc 6.

She has long [[brown hair]], tied into a [[high ponytail]], [[green eyes]] with [[extra pupils]], and a [[single braid]] with a [[star hair ornament]]. She usually wears a [[two-sided fabric]] [[cape]], black [[front-tie bikini top]], and black [[short shorts]].

title: bi-han
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan, and the original [[Sub-Zero]].

In the first two timelines, he is the more sinister and ambitious counterpart of [[Kuai Liang]], his younger brother. He was killed by [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]] in the first Mortal Kombat tournament, his brother inheriting his title, before eventually becoming the ninja specter [[Noob Saibot]]. As such, depictions of Sub-Zero from the original Mortal Kombat, "Classic Sub-Zero":[https://twitter.com/therealsaibot/status/895301414620024832] from Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3, his associated "outfit":[https://mortalkombat.fandom.com/wiki/File:Sub-Zero_R1.jpg] in [[Mortal Kombat 9]], and all depictions of Noob are Bi-Han. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]] meanwhile, he survives and remains Sub-Zero, becoming Lin Kuei Grandmaster, with his brother being Scorpion instead.

title: new_taiwan_dollar
body:
The New Taiwan dollar (code: TWD; symbol: NT$, also abbreviated as NT) is the official currency of the [[Taiwan|Republic of China (Taiwan)]]. 

The basic unit of the New Taiwan dollar is called a yuan (圓) and is subdivided into ten chiao (角), and into 100 fen (分) or cents, although in practice both chiao and fen are never actually used.

title: kuai_liang
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan.

In the first two timelines, he inherited the mantle of [[Sub-Zero]] following the death of the first Sub-Zero, his older brother [[Bi-Han]], becoming Lin Kuei Grandmaster in the process. He would help the heroes of Earthrealm on numerous occasions, even when that meant fighting his own clan. As such, all main depictions of Sub-Zero that aren't explicitly Bi-Han, from Mortal Kombat 2 to [[Mortal Kombat 11]], are Kuai Liang. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]] meanwhile, he has become [[Scorpion (mortal kombat)|]]. [spoiler]Due to the events of MK1, he would leave the Lin Kuei and form the Shirai Ryu, named after his wife, [[Harumi Shirai]]. The original Scorpion, [[Hanzo Hasashi]], would join the Shirai Ryu as a kid.[/spoiler]

title: she_is_beautiful
body:
A 2022-to-Present sci-fi mystery manga series by Esaka Jun and illustrated by [[Totsuno Takahide]].

The series follows Kurumi, a girl raised by the mysterious institute, Familie.  At this institute girls are raised from birth in various fields from the arts to firearms. The girls at the age of 10 are assigned to specialized classes and Kurumi hopes that she will be assigned to the arts class alongside her close friend Hikari.  Going to sleep on her 10th birthday, Kurumi awakes to find that 14 years has passed and she's now staying in a remote forest cabin with her former classmate Sayaka; a girl she didn't get along with.  With no memories of what has happened, can she trust what Sayaka is telling her has happened.

h4. Characters

* [[Kurumi_(She_is_Beautiful)|]]

title: sub-zero
body:
[b]Sub-Zero[/b] is a character in the [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] series. A [[ninja]] of the Chinese Lin Kuei clan, Sub-Zero has command over the element of ice, and has the ability to freeze his foes solid.

Two people have taken the mantle of Sub-Zero. The first, [[Bi-Han]], was killed by [[Scorpion (Mortal Kombat)|]] in the first Mortal Kombat tournament before eventually becoming the ninja specter [[Noob Saibot]]. He would be succeeded by the second Sub-Zero, [[Kuai Liang]], his younger brother. In the third MK timeline, as introduced in [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)]], Bi-Han's fate is changed, and he remains Sub-Zero. His brother, meanwhile, is now Scorpion.

title: shinano_(kancolle)
body:
The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[aircraft carrier|supercarrier]] of the same name as she might be depicted in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].

[i]Shinano[/i] has yet to be added in [[Kantai Collection]], but there seems to be a chance of her to be implemented due to a design (drawn by the artist Youki) of her appearing in the official [[doujinshi]] books [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi[/i] and [i]Teitoku no Fuyuyasumi[/i] with the pages of her being titled "Future Asset". The two books were released in 2013, and as of yet is not in the game.

In [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi/Fuyuyasumi[/i] she has [[long hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] in a [[single braid]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]], generic green and red [[Japanese clothes]], and a [[yugake]]. She wields a [[bow (weapon)|bow]] and her [[flight deck]].

This tag will be used if she is officially implemented into the game, but for now this tag is used for either fan designs or her [i]Teitoku no Natsuyasumi/Fuyuyasumi[/i] design.

h4. History

The historical [i]Shinano[/i] was laid down May 4, 1940. She was originally planned to be the third "[i]Yamato[/i]-class battleship":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato-class_battleship, but after the loss of the aircraft carriers "[i]Akagi[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Akagi, "[i]Kaga[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Kaga, "[i]Hiryuu[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Hiryū, and "[i]Souryuu[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Sōryū after the [[Battle of Midway]] she was converted into a supercarrier as her hull was partially incomplete.

In theory, [i]Shinano[/i] was capable of fielding the largest airwing of any aircraft carrier constructed by the end of World War II and was kept secret as she was meant to be a strategic surprise. However, due to the advanced state of her construction as a battleship before conversion, [i]Shinano[/i] has a dispropotionally small hangar size of 47 aircrafts (in comparison, the light aircraft carrier [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] accommodated 48 aircrafts despite her displacement is almost 7 times less than that of Shinano's). Due to this, the IJN planned to use [i]Shinano[/i] as a support carrier to tend the other fleet carrier's air wings.

[i]Shinano[/i] was launched October 8, 1944 (originally planned to launced May 1945, but her construction was expedited due to the "Battle of the Philippine Sea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Philippine_Sea)]) and commissioned November 19, 1944. [i]Shinano[/i] was dispatched from Yokosuka to Kure with an inexperienced crew to finish her fitting out and embark her aircraft, but she was sunk en-route by  "[i]USS Archerfish[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Archerfish_%28SS-311%29 on November 29, 1944. [i]Shinano[/i] was the the largest warship ever sunken by a submarine.

[i]Shinano[/i] was named after the old "Shinano Province":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinano_Province], now modern day "Nagano Prefecture":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagano_Prefecture].

h4. See also

* [[Shinano (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Shinano (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shinano[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Shinano

title: hi_no_tori_2772
body:
[b]Phoenix 2772[/b] ([i]Hi no Tori 2772: Ai no Kosumozōn[/i] - [i]Firebird 2772: Love's Cosmozone[/i]) is an animated feature film directed by Sugiyama Taku and co-scripted by [[Tezuka Osamu]], based on his manga series [[Hi no Tori]]. The epic science fiction and fantasy film premiered on March 15, 1980 in Japan.

It was then released in the UK in 1980 under the title [i]Space Firebird[/i], and later in the United States in 1983, shortened to 79 minutes and dubbed by British voice-actors. A French version had also been released under the title [i]Firebird 2772[/i].

title: kirby:_triple_deluxe
body:
The first [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]], released in 2014. Following the trend set by [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], this game takes a relatively safe approach with traditional gameplay mechanics. The central mechanic this time around is the new Hypernova ability, which boost Kirby's Inhale to ridiculous proportions.

Kirby was chilling in Dream Land one day when a giant Dreamstalk suddenly grows from underneath his house! He goes to Castle Dedede to investigate, but before he could confront [[King Dedede]], a [[taranza|mysterious spider mage]] appears from behind and captures the king. Kirby immediately gives chase, starting an uphill adventure!

title: gial_ackbar
body: Fleet Admiral Gial Ackbar is a fictional character from the [[Star Wars]] franchise. A member of the amphibious Mon Calamari species, Ackbar was the foremost military commander of the Rebel Alliance, and led the attack against the second [[Death Star]] in [[Star Wars: Return of the Jedi]] (1983), Admiral Ackbar's line, "It's a trap!", which he says during the Battle of Endor in Return of the Jedi, became one of the most famous and beloved lines from the original Star Wars trilogy, the line has become a popular internet [[meme]].

title: akadora
body: Specifically marked red dora tiles. If included in the game, these "red fives" automatically count as dora, regardless of the dora indicator. If the dora indicator is a four, the red five of the same suit counts as two dora. Most modern sets will include two red 5p, one red 5m, and one red 5s, and one red five of each suit is used in actual play.

title: suushiihou
body: The two wind-based yakuman: shousuushii 「小四喜」 and daisuushii 「大四喜」. Both involve all four wind tiles. Shousuushii requires three groups winds, and a pair of the last wind, while daisuushii requires groups of all four. Both are worth yakuman, though daisuushii can be worth double yakuman if a ruleset allows it.

title: yoshino_chidori
body:
The only female member of Strega, a team of three acting as the antagonist team in [[Persona 3]] and its re-releases.

Chidori has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] and wears [[white dress|white]] [[lolita fashion]]. She is commonly seen drawing sketches in the park until [[Iori Junpei]] meets her. She also has a bad habit of cutting herself though the wounds quickly heal, provided by her persona Medea.

In battle, she uses an [[axe]] on a [[chain]].

title: hades_project_zeorymer
body:
Japanese title: 冥王計画ゼオライマー (pronounced as Project Zeorymer)
Official English title: Hades Project Zeorymer

A manga and OVA series by Takaya Yoshiki (going under the pseudonym Chimi Morio), though the two versions have completely different settings and stories. The OVA version features mecha and character redesigns by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] and [[Kikuchi Michitaka]] respectively.

The original manga was followed up with a sequel in [[Hades Project Zeorymer Omega]].

Features one of the most overpowered main character mechs ever.

Also, MEI-OH.

title: panic!_at_the_disco
body:
[b]Panic! At The Disco[/b] was a former American Alternative Pop Rock led by lead vocalist Brendon Urie. Forming in 2004, the band has spawn several Hit Songs including "I Write Sins Not Tragedies",  "But It's Better If You Do" and "High Hopes". 

Due to the band's constant change of band members and Urie focusing on his solo career and family life, Panic! At The Disco was disbanded in 2023.

title: data_(star_trek)
body:
A character from [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]. A lieutenant-commander in the operations branch of Starfleet stationed on the [[uss enterprise ncc-1701-d|USS Enterprise]], he is a Soong-type [[android]] who wishes to be human and experience emotions, and thus tries to understand the behaviors of humans. His personality is clearly supposed to resemble that of someone on the autism spectrum.

He has [[pale eye|pale]] [[green eyes]], [[brown hair|brown]] [[hair slicked back|slicked back]] hair and wears a yellow 2360s-era [[starfleet uniform]]. He is portrayed by the American actor Brent Spiner.

h1. External links
* "Memory Alpha":[https://memory-alpha.fandom.com/wiki/Data]
* "Star Trek":[https://www.startrek.com/database_article/data]

title: seaport_summer_princess
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] enemy [[abyssal ship]] introduced in the Summer 2016 Event. Her voice actress is unknown. She is based on Singapore.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering the left side of her face]] and [[blue eyes]]. Wears a [[white dress]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[sun hat]] with a large black [[hat flower|flower on it]]. Her [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high_heel_boots|high heeled]] [[armored_boots|armored]] [[thigh_boots|thigh boots]] comprised of [[machinery]] appearing to be part of her actual body. She rides on a large monster and has small cutesy familiars. Alongside her is a beach bag, umbrella, and a plate with a drink on it.

title: inkan
body:
A small [[ink stamp]] like device typically marked with red ink used in place of a signature on a document or any item requiring acknowledgement or authorship.

The term [i]hanko[/i] (判子) is refered to inkan used on less important documents.

title: akagi_shuntaro
body: The protagonist of the manga "[[Tsukiji Uogashi Sandaime]]". He is a former bank employee who, without any knowledge of the business, takes over as the third generation of "Uotatsu", a fish wholesaler in Tsukiji Fish Market, following in the footsteps of his father-in-law. He is commonly referred to as "Sandaime" (lit. "the third generation") by those around him. With his inherent cheerfulness, love for food, and curiosity, he solves various problems that arise through Tsukiji and fish. The manga has also been adapted into a film, with Oosawa Takao playing the role of Shuntaro.

title: kawamori_shouji
body:
河森正治 [b]Kawamori Shōuji[/b] (born February 2, 1960 in Toyama, Japan) is a renowned japanese anime creator, screenwriter and designer, having created or co-created such notable series as [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], [[Tenkuu no Escaflowne]], [[Earth Girl Arjuna]], [[Sousei no Aquarion]], [[Macross 7]], [[Macross Frontier]], [[Basquash!]], [[AKB0048]] and [[Macross Delta]]. He directed the anime film [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] in 1984, when he was only 24 years old.

Kawamori attended Keio University in the same years as Macross screenwriter Ōnogi Hiroshi and character designer [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]] (where they had a [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] fanclub called "Gunsight-1"). He occasionally used the alias 黒河影次 Kurokawa Eiji early in his career when he started as a member of Studio Nue. 

Kawamori Shouji is also an accomplished visual artist and [[mecha]] designer. Some of his early anime works include designs for [[Techno Police 21C]], [[Ulysses 31]] and [[Crusher Joe]]. He may be best known as the designer of the legendary [[VF-1]] [b]Valkyrie[/b] from [[MACROSS]] and the original [b]Convoy[/b] ([[Optimus Prime]]) toy for [[Transformers]]. 

Each and every variable fighter from the Macross series (except those from [[Macross 2]]) was created by him. 

These and other designs have established Kawamori as a (perhaps the) master of transforming mecha. He’s also known for designing the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] and the [[Gundam GP-02 Physalis]] from [[Gundam 0083]]. Kawamori has also created designs for videogames like [[Choukou Senki Kikaiou]] ([[Rafaga]]) and the [[Armored Core]] series. He still works with Studio Nue on certain projects. The majority of his designs are sleek and aerodynamic although he’s quite versatile – many people have trouble identifying Kawamori designs. He is sought after as a mecha designer and has worked on a large variety of projects and continues to produce and direct anime TV series and OVA’s.

Kawamori is currently executive director at the animation studio Satelight. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, ecological concern... and lots of music idols. 

h4. Famous Designs:

* [[Optimus Prime]] G1 Design ([[Transformers]])
* [[VF-1]] Valkyrie ([[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]])
* [[Gundam GP-02 Physalis]] ([[Gundam 0083]])
* [[YF-19]] Alpha One ([[Macross Plus]])
* [[VF-19]] [[Fire Valkyrie]] ([[Macross 7]])
* [[VF-25]] Messiah ([[Macross Frontier]])
* [[Solar Aquarion]] ([[Sousei No Aquarion]])

h4. See also

* [[Kawamori Shouji (style)]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":http://www.satelight.co.jp/kawamori
